approach_and_lure.communication_migration: No explicit migration mentioned - likely remained on initial platforms or moved to unspecified messaging app

scammer_persona.claimed_identity: Moses (investment mentor/teacher) and Vivian (professional broker/advisor associated with FRTC Limited Broker)
wealth_indicators: crypto trading expertise and teaching capability (Moses)

impersonation_and_psychology.trust_building_period: Victim 1: Days to weeks with progressive onboarding and initial success; Victim 2: Extended period over time with multiple deposits and $1.66M displayed profits, including successful $55,000 withdrawal to establish legitimacy

withdrawal_block_tactics: Victim 1: Sudden catastrophic loss - $75,000 deposit lost in minutes via claimed trading losses
Victim 2: Scammer offered to contribute $350,000 toward taxes as pressure/reciprocity tactic
Victim 2: Account locked and closed when victim refused to pay tax demand
Proof-of-concept withdrawal ($55,000) allowed to establish platform legitimacy before large-scale exit
Multi-stage escalation with collaborative investment encouragement

payment_methods: cryptocurrency transfers (specific exchanges and methods not stated)
crypto purchased per Moses' instructions and sent to platform account
funds transferred to FRTC platform account

temporal_indicators.scam_duration: Victim 1: Estimated 1-4 weeks (rapid extraction model); Victim 2: Estimated 2-6 months (extended pig butchering with multiple deposits over time and $1.66M profit display)

extraction_metadata.notes: This case demonstrates a sophisticated pig butchering operation with multiple distinct tactical approaches: (1) RAPID EXTRACTION (Victim 1/Moses): WhatsApp contact, mentorship lure, quick onboarding, initial success followed by sudden $75k loss in minutes via claimed trading volatility - fast-exit model; (2) EXTENDED PIG BUTCHERING (Victim 2/Vivian): LinkedIn professional approach, extended relationship over time with multiple deposits, $1.66M fake profits displayed, CRITICAL $55k successful withdrawal to prove legitimacy, then 45% tax barrier ($747k demand) with scammer offering $350k contribution as reciprocity pressure, ending in account lock/closure. The operation shows high sophistication: multi-platform targeting (WhatsApp + LinkedIn), gender-diverse personas suggesting organized group, victim-tailored approaches (fast vs. slow con), and proof-of-concept withdrawal capability. The $55k successful withdrawal is a key tactical element that distinguishes this from simpler scams - it overcomes withdrawal skepticism and makes subsequent large tax demands seem plausible. Both California residents unable to recover funds. Estimated total losses: $75k confirmed (Victim 1) + $100k-$500k estimated (Victim 2 deposits) = $175k-$575k combined. Platform operated at frtcnet.live and frtc.net. Critical gap: no blockchain tracking data (addresses/hashes) limits financial investigation capability.
